Package com.intellij.execution.actions

Class ConfigurationContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.execution.actions.ConfigurationContext

  • public class ConfigurationContext
extends java.lang.Object
    Context for creating run configurations from a location in the source code.
    See Also:
    RunConfigurationProducer

      • getOriginalConfiguration

        public RunConfiguration getOriginalConfiguration(ConfigurationType type)
        Returns original RunConfiguration from this context. For example, it could be some test framework runtime configuration that had been launched and that had brought a result test tree on which a right-click action was performed.
        Parameters:
        type - ConfigurationType instance to filter original runtime configuration by its type
        Returns:
        RunConfiguration instance, it could be null

      • isCompatibleWithOriginalRunConfiguration

        public boolean isCompatibleWithOriginalRunConfiguration(ConfigurationType type)
        Checks if the original run configuration matches the passed type. If the original run configuration is undefined, the check is passed too. An original run configuration is a run configuration associated with given context. For example, it could be a test framework run configuration that had been launched and that had brought a result test tree on which a right-click action was performed (and this context was created). In this case, other run configuration producers might want to not work on such elements.
        Parameters:
        type - ConfigurationType instance to match the original run configuration
        Returns:
        true if the original run configuration is of the same type or it's undefined; false otherwise

      • findPreferredProducers
